storyTitle: As Schedule Manager, I want the system to validate schedules to detect conflicts to ensure compliance and accuracy

testCases.title: Detect overlapping shifts for an employee
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Manager with valid credentials
Schedule management system is accessible
At least one employee exists in the system with valid employee ID
Labor rules and validation engine are configured and active
User has permissions to create and modify schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page and select an employee from the employee list
steps.expectedResult: Employee selection interface is displayed with available employees listed

steps.action: Create a first shift for the selected employee with start time 09:00 AM and end time 05:00 PM on the same day
steps.expectedResult: First shift is created and displayed in the schedule grid

steps.action: Create a second shift for the same employee with start time 02:00 PM and end time 10:00 PM on the same day (overlapping with first shift)
steps.expectedResult: Second shift is created and schedule is saved to the system

steps.action: Click the 'Validate Schedule' button or trigger automatic validation
steps.expectedResult: Validation process initiates and completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Observe the validation results displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: System flags the overlapping shifts with a clear visual indicator (e.g., red highlight or warning icon) and displays an error message indicating 'Overlapping shifts detected for employee [Employee Name]'

steps.action: Click on the conflict notification or flagged shifts to view detailed conflict information
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information is displayed showing both shift times and the overlap period

steps.action: Review the conflict resolution suggestions provided by the system
steps.expectedResult: System displays actionable suggestions such as 'Adjust shift times', 'Reassign second shift to different employee', or 'Remove overlapping shift' with clickable options

postconditions: Overlapping shifts remain flagged in the system until resolved
Schedule is marked as invalid and cannot be finalized
Conflict details are logged in the system for audit purposes
Manager is able to take corrective action based on suggestions

testCases.title: Validate minimum rest period between shifts
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Manager with valid credentials
Schedule management system is accessible
Minimum rest period rule is configured in the system (e.g., 11 hours between shifts)
At least one employee exists in the system
User has permissions to create and modify schedules

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page and select an employee
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation interface is displayed with selected employee

steps.action: Create a first shift for the employee with start time 06:00 PM and end time 02:00 AM (next day)
steps.expectedResult: First shift is created and saved successfully

steps.action: Create a second consecutive shift for the same employee with start time 08:00 AM (same day as shift end) and end time 04:00 PM (only 6 hours rest between shifts)
steps.expectedResult: Second shift is created and schedule is saved to the system

steps.action: Click the 'Validate Schedule' button to run validation checks
steps.expectedResult: Validation process executes and completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Review the validation results displayed on the screen
steps.expectedResult: System reports a rest period violation with message 'Minimum rest period violation: Only 6 hours between shifts. Required: 11 hours' and highlights the affected shifts

steps.action: Note the suggested resolution options provided by the system
steps.expectedResult: System displays suggestions such as 'Move second shift to start at 01:00 PM or later' or 'Reassign second shift to different employee'

steps.action: Adjust the second shift start time to 02:00 PM (providing 12 hours rest)
steps.expectedResult: Shift time is updated successfully in the schedule

steps.action: Click 'Validate Schedule' button again to revalidate the adjusted schedule
steps.expectedResult: Validation process runs successfully

steps.action: Review the validation results after adjustment
steps.expectedResult: No violations are found, system displays 'Schedule validated successfully' message with green indicator, and schedule is marked as valid

postconditions: Schedule passes all validation checks
No rest period violations exist in the schedule
Schedule is eligible for finalization
Validation results are logged in the system
Employee has adequate rest period between consecutive shifts

storyTitle: As Schedule Manager, I want to receive notifications about schedule conflicts to take timely corrective actions

testCases.title: Receive notification for detected schedule conflict
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Manager with valid credentials
Notification system is enabled and functioning
User has permissions to create schedules and view notifications
At least one employee exists in the system
Notification preferences are configured for the manager
Real-time conflict detection is active

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation interface is displayed

steps.action: Create a schedule with a conflict by assigning overlapping shifts to the same employee (e.g., Shift 1: 09:00 AM - 05:00 PM, Shift 2: 03:00 PM - 11:00 PM on the same day)
steps.expectedResult: Both shifts are created and saved in the system

steps.action: Wait for the system to automatically detect the conflict (should occur within 1 minute)
steps.expectedResult: System detects the overlapping shift conflict and triggers the notification generation process

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section in the UI by clicking the notifications icon or menu item
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page is displayed showing all active notifications

steps.action: Locate and review the newly generated conflict notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification is displayed with conflict details including: employee name, conflicting shift times, conflict type (overlapping shifts), and timestamp of detection

steps.action: Click on the notification to view full details
steps.expectedResult: Detailed notification view opens showing complete conflict information and suggested actions such as 'Adjust shift times' or 'Reassign one shift'

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification status changes to 'Acknowledged', visual indicator (e.g., checkmark) appears, and notification is marked with acknowledgment timestamp

steps.action: Verify the notification status in the notifications list
steps.expectedResult: Notification shows 'Acknowledged' status with the manager's name and acknowledgment time displayed

postconditions: Notification is marked as acknowledged in the system
Notification remains visible in the notifications list with acknowledged status
Acknowledgment is logged with timestamp and user information
Conflict remains unresolved but manager is aware of the issue
Notification delivery and acknowledgment are recorded in the system logs

testCases.title: Dismiss notification and verify status
preconditions: User is logged in as Schedule Manager with valid credentials
At least one active notification exists in the system
Notification system is functioning properly
User has permissions to view and manage notifications
Notification history logging is enabled

steps.action: Navigate to the notifications section by clicking the notifications icon in the main navigation
steps.expectedResult: Notifications page is displayed showing list of active notifications

steps.action: Locate a specific notification from the list and click on it to select
steps.expectedResult: Selected notification is highlighted and notification details panel opens showing full information including conflict type, affected employee, shift details, and suggested actions

steps.action: Review the notification details displayed in the details panel
steps.expectedResult: All notification information is clearly visible including timestamp, conflict description, and available actions

steps.action: Click the 'Dismiss' button located in the notification details panel or notification item
steps.expectedResult: Confirmation dialog appears asking 'Are you sure you want to dismiss this notification?'

steps.action: Confirm the dismissal action by clicking 'Yes' or 'Confirm' in the dialog
steps.expectedResult: Notification is dismissed, confirmation message 'Notification dismissed successfully' appears, and notification is removed from the active notifications list

steps.action: Verify that the dismissed notification is no longer visible in the active notifications list
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed notification does not appear in the active notifications list, notification count is decremented by one

steps.action: Navigate to the notification history section or filter notifications by 'Dismissed' status
steps.expectedResult: Notification history page or filtered view is displayed

steps.action: Search for the dismissed notification in the history using the notification ID or timestamp
steps.expectedResult: Dismissed notification is found in the history with status 'Dismissed', showing dismissal timestamp, manager who dismissed it, and original notification details preserved

steps.action: Verify the notification log entry contains complete information
steps.expectedResult: Log entry shows notification creation time, dismissal time, manager name, notification type, and all relevant conflict details

postconditions: Notification is removed from active notifications list
Notification status is permanently set to 'Dismissed'
Dismissal action is logged with timestamp and user information
Notification is accessible in notification history for audit purposes
System maintains complete audit trail of notification lifecycle
Dismissed notification cannot be re-activated
